clinicalDescription: Overview: abbreviated IRIS. a collection of inflammatory disorders associated with paradoxical worsening of preexisting infectious processes following the initiation of antiretroviral therapy (ART) in HIV-infected individuals Presentation: Symptoms associated with prior infections at the site of pre-existing infection (for example, people with HIV on ART who were previously treated for pulmonary tuberculosis may have new fevers, malaise, weight loss and worsening respiratory symptoms). Multiple infections previously cleared by the patient can be the culprit: cryptococcus, CMV, JC virus, pneumocystis, Hepatitis B and C, for example Assessment: Distinguish from active infection with history and physical examination, including opportunistic infections. Plan: Supportive care and glucocorticoids may be needed for severe symptoms. Treat for opportunistic infections if indicated. Continue ART. Prognosis: Usually self-limited with good prognosis.
